address: Xã Vĩnh Trạch, Huyện Thoại Sơn, Tỉnh An Giang
thought:
**Analysis of Administrative Unit Changes for "Xã Vĩnh Trạch"**

Okay, so I'm looking at this old address: "Xã Vĩnh Trạch, Huyện Thoại Sơn, Tỉnh An Giang." My goal is to determine the new administrative unit (ward) it corresponds to. First, I break down the address: "Xã Vĩnh Trạch" (ward), "Huyện Thoại Sơn" (district, for context), and "Tỉnh An Giang" (province).

The initial step is to cross-reference this information with relevant resolutions. I can immediately identify that "Tỉnh An Giang" isn't changing based on the resolution related to province mergers (60-NQ/TW). The province remains "Tỉnh An Giang."

Next, I delve into the key resolution: "1654/NQ-UBTVQH15." This resolution focuses on ward-level reorganizations within An Giang. I scrutinized several lines, and bingo, line "42" specifically addresses my target. It states that the old "Xã Vĩnh Trạch" is merging with "Xã Vĩnh Khánh" to *form a new* "Xã Vĩnh Trạch". This is the crux of the matter.

Then, I looked at the new ward data. I found a match: a ward named "Xã Vĩnh Trạch" (ward code: 30697) in "Tỉnh An Giang."  The name and province coincide with the old address, and the resolution tells me the composition of the new ward explicitly includes the original "Xã Vĩnh Trạch."

Therefore, the old "Xã Vĩnh Trạch" in An Giang is now represented by the new "Xã Vĩnh Trạch" with the ward code "30697." The name remains the same, but the administrative boundary and composition have been adjusted.  I'm confident in this conclusion.

citation.header: 1654/NQ-UBTVQH15: Sắp xếp các đơn vị hành chính cấp xã của tỉnh An Giang
citation.line: 42. Sắp xếp toàn bộ diện tích tự nhiên, quy mô dân số của xã Vĩnh Khánh và xã Vĩnh Trạch thành xã mới có tên gọi là xã Vĩnh Trạch.
